alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 3:34AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Oahu in Honolulu County. * WHEN...Until 700 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over windward Oahu, with the heaviest rain falling from Kaneohe to Laie. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour and area streams are rising quickly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waikane, Waiahole, Kahaluu, Kaaawa, Ahuimanu, Punaluu, Pearl City, Mililani, Aiea, Hauula, Wahiawa, Halawa, Moanalua, Kaneohe, Salt Lake, Laie, Kaneohe Marine Base, Kalihi, Maunawili and Kahuku. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 700 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
